sn56.36:4.1: Suppose a person was to strip all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in India, gather them together into one pile,
sn56.36:4.3: Then they’d impale the large creatures in the ocean on large stakes; the medium-sized creatures on medium-sized stakes; and the small creatures on small stakes.
sn56.36:4.4: They wouldn’t run out of sizable creatures in the ocean before
sn56.36:5.1: using up all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in India.
sn56.36:5.2: There’s far more small creatures in the ocean than this, so it wouldn’t be feasible to impale them on stakes.
sn56.36:5.4: Because of the small size of those life-forms.
sn56.36:5.5: That’s how big the plane of loss is.
sn56.36:5.6: A person accomplished in view, exempt from that vast plane of loss, truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn56.36:6.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
